result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla Marissa Roche was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
*The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.  Restitution is set at ZERO.
*Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
*Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
*The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor. The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.

*No Facebook or social media use.
*No contact with victim, G.H.

*Mental health assessment and treatment.
*Anger management classes.
*Parenting classes.
*Comply with all Children Court orders.

*ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kayla Marissa Roche

records.addlTxt:
Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ X ]   Review / Modification Request / Recommended - Request to Issue Civil Judgment for Restitution and/or Court Costs - forwarded to Sheryl
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
Original SENTENCING Transcript (22 pages) commencing 03/10/16 received and filed.

Defendant Kayla Marissa Roche in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  
Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation Agent Melissa Porter.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for probation review.  Hearing proceeded.  Parties in receipt of report dated 5-26-16 authored by Agent Porter.
Statements made by the state, defense, agent, and defendant.  Compliance issues discussed with the court.  
The Court advises the agent to request commitment if any additional probation violations occur.  
The Court advises the defendant that a six month commitment may be issued in the future non-compliance continues.  The Court takes no action today.

Received in writing and filed:  Probation Status Report from 
probation/parole agent. ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.

Defendant Kayla Marissa Roche in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Kayla Marissa Roche in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by counsels and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 25 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 64 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 13 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 12 MONTHS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 36 MONTHS.  Conditions of probation include:
-Serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction STAYED for review on 6-1-2016.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.  Restitution is set at ZERO.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-Seek and maintain employment
-Mental health assessment and treatment
-Anger management classes
-Parenting classes
-Comply with all Children Court orders
-No Facebook or social media use
-No contact with victim, G.H..
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of determinate sentence, and advised of her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Filed, Pretrial Credit
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief  Review hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Kayla Marissa Roche in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Kayla Marissa Roche in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for Kim Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  As to the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.     Defendant remanded pending sentencing on 3-10-2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Kayla Marissa Roche not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger on behalf of Kimberly Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense waived the defendant's appearance for this hearing. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State and requested a plea and sentencing date. Parties advised as of February 1, 2016, this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38, Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Signed and filed, (NEW) No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with G.H. and address listed on NO CONTACT ORDER.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Kayla Marissa Roche in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Kayla Marissa Roche in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DH dob 12/4/98 or the address listed on the criminal complaint.

Defendant Kayla Marissa Roche in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kayla Marissa Roche in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.    
Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kayla Marissa Roche
Current: 420 W Washington Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 01-08-2016)
Prior: 1410 South 112th Street, West Allis, WI 53214
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
